_header: In heaven there sit a lady…
Note: Fragment only, missing ends of lines; for similar pieces see 4826 and 6781
Subjects: women, praise of; carols, of women
_description: In praise of women — five 3-line stanzas and burden: Women ben good for lo[ve] / …that sit above

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
In euyn þer sitte a lady [schene?]Of all women sche [
                    ]…
CamStJohn259.Last Lines:
…Women ben goo[d ]Women to vs [ ]Women to le[
                    ]
CamStJohn259.Note: Text fragmentary because most of folio torn away.
CamStJohn259.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 85.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 322; 1977, 294.
